result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Brett Charles Douglas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Battery [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
1) The defendant will have no further contacts w/law enforcement during term of agrmt. that give rise to probable cause for arrest due to criminal conduct.
2)Defendant shall notify Pepin County District Attorney's Office of any change of residence or employment.
3)One month prior to completion of contract, defendant must contact Pepin County District Attorney's Office for a final interview.
4)Report in person as requested by the Pepin County District Attorney or other supervisor designated by him.
5) The defendant must follow the rules and regulations as set forth by probation, if applicable.
ADDITIONAL CONDITIONS:
A.  I will cooperate with law enforcement and provide truthful testimony against any and all codefendants in this matter.
B.  I understand that a probation violation will be considered a violation of this agreement.  I will immediately inform the DA's office of any probation violations.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

miscConds.notes:
Pay costs according to a schedule set by Probation & Parole.  
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

timeConds.notes: Serve 140 days in the Pepin County Jail with work release.  May be served in Buffalo County if arrangements can be made and at no cost to Pepin County.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

miscConds.notes: All conditions same and concurrent with Count 2 except no conditional jail on Count 3.

records.addlTxt: Order to Dismiss Count 1 of criminal complaint.
Deferred Acceptance of Guilty Plea Agreement
Proof of payment of $413.50 to DOC for CO obs.
Defendant Brett Charles Douglas not in court.   Mr. Douglas nearing discharge.  Warrant authorized for FTA and if not paid by 12/21, report to jail on 12/22 at 6 p.m.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Brett Charles Douglas in court with attorney William A. Schembera.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agreement reached, defendant will plead guilty to count 1 offer DAGPA or NCP agreement; defendant will plead to counts 2 & 3; move to dismiss counts 4 & 5; request 2 yrs probation on counts 2 & 3 and sentence to 140 days in the PCJ.  Court advises defendant of charges/max penalties in counts 2 & 3 and count 1.  Defendant enters plea of guilty to Counts 2 & 3; subject to DPA, pleads guilty to Count 1.  Defendant previously completed & filed PLQ/WOR, court reviewed with defendant. Court advises defendant of felony prohibitions if agreement would be revoked and convicted of count 1.  Court finds defendant's waiver of his constitutional rights and plea done knowingly & voluntarily, accepts pleas in counts 2 & 3 and finds defendant guilty.  Court approves DPA in count 1.  Court withholds sentence and places defendant on 2 yrs. probation with conditions:  count 2 140 days in PCJ w/work release w/credit for 105 days served; count 3 no conditional jail; jail sentence to com. March 19 at 6 p.m.; may serve in Buffalo County if arrangements can be made and at no cost to Pepin Co.; pay costs $443 x 2; provide DNA sample; cooperate with law enforcement...; no contact with co-defs.; no contact with victims; comply with any other assessment or counseling set up by P&P.

ADDRESS INFO for Brett Charles Douglas
Current: W1983 Cty Rd D, Nelson, WI 54756 United States  (Effective: 02-13-2017)
Prior: Buffalo County Jail, Alma, WI 54610
Plea hearing on February 13, 2017 at 02:00 pm.

Order to Transport.
The warden/superintendent with physical custody of the person subject to this order at the time of its execution shall make that person available to the sheriff of Pepin County.  The sheriff shall convey that person to 740 7th Avenue West for proceedings in the Circuit Court of Pepin County on  January 23, 2017 at 11:30  a.m.
Plea hearing on January 23, 2017 at 11:30 am.

Defendant Brett Charles Douglas in court with attorney William A. Schembera.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement reached, defendant will plead to count 2 & 3 with joint recommendation, count 1 DAGPA.  Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing.  Information filed with the Court.  Court wants more information about Mr. Douglas before he will approve the DPA, informs counsel to get another date.
Adjourned initial appearance on December 20, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Court confirms defendant received copy of criminal complaint, advises of charges/max. penalties and rights.  State requests $1000 Sign. Bond with conditions:   No contact with victims:  JDM, CJM, BLR; No contact with co-defendants:  Mark Hillestad, Brett Douglas, Jordan Meixner, Devin Seiler, Maxwell Holden. Defendant wishes to not schedule PH w/in 20 days, wants to contact an atty first.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for December 20, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
